content: The actual game screen is less than 2/3 of the device screen. And you can't zoom out. So you can only really see half a dozen of your buildings at a time. The tutorial is brutal. The "advisor" is an impatient jerk who interrupts you if he doesn't think you are moving fast enough following his vague directions. And even though at the end he says the tutorial is over, he still pops up every subsequent round.
replyContent: Jason, hi! We are sorry to hear about your disappointment with our game but respect your opinion. We will take into account your feedback working on our future projects.

content: More levels please for all versions of this game

content: It's a good mobile version of a classic game! I just wish there were a few more of the hero options from the original such a s getting the temples to the sun and moon. The amount that they reduced the hero variety makes it feel almost like a gameboy variant instead of an android version. But it's still enjoyable. Still, I'd pay extra to get some of these missing heroes added back in, such as the rogue and the 2 missing temples
replyContent: Ben, hi! Thank you for taking out time to send us your feedback! We will forward it to our development team. But we need to say that we do not plan to update this game with new gameplay features or change existing ones. :)

content: This game is actually pretty good. Tough to understand at first and certain things aren't clear either. I love the idea of this indirect control, conquest type game. Certain things I would prefer slightly more control, specifically the leveling of heroes. You will have many heroes level hugely and then get wasted by main boss and so you're stuck with level ones who in turn get wasted. If you could pour gold into characters so they at least can get better equipment starting out that could help

content: Game translates great to mobile. The music is abysmal though, and the humour is a bit sexist and really lame. For example, each class only has like 10 random names and 7 of them are lord of the ring references. Cringe, but the gameplay is great. Highly recommended.

content: I don't understand the system of unlocking levels!! The game seems to only unlock one level each time you complete a level... So you're forced to do the next level in the line, without any of the side levels opening. This means I'm suddenly stuck at the hardest level (which is crazy difficult, even when I'm playing on easy) with no other level options available. Apparently the only way to unlock those side levels is to pay more money to "buy keys to the kingdom". Am I missing something, or is this a trick to get us to pay more money??
replyContent: Hello! If you are struggle with the walkthrough, please use this guide: https://gamefaqs.gamespot.com/pc/378094-majesty-the-northern-expansion/faqs/10687

content: This is a great option for playing Majesty on the go.  I loved Majesty when I first played it almost 20 years ago, and I liked the sequel when I played it almost a decade ago.    This mobile version is missing some features from the original game, but it's a pretty faithful representation of the game - and it's a great value. You can get the game and this expansion for under $5 - can't really complain.  So many games similar to this are free to play, but just push micro-transactions to actually play the game.    This is more-or-less the same game that was released in 2000, so it's completely possible to play without spending any more money after the initial purchase price.   I'd like to eventually see an updated version that adds in the missing features from the original - or even update the graphics to match the original.   Overall, though - I'm very happy with this game. It's fun and a good price. It definitely scratched that old Majesty itch. Maybe someday we'll get a Majesty 3 on PC...
replyContent: We are happy to see that you like our game!

content: Have had no issues since the recent update. Always runs smooth as long as I turn the weather off. Fun game, new levels adds some good variety and challenge. content: Pretty good and well worth the money. It could use some changes though. The temple of Kromar is kind of garbage compared to the other temples. Maybe allocate some of the buff spells like invisibility to that. The tier 3 spell for the necromancer temple is basically just a weaker version of revive that costs more to cast. A more unique spell would be cooler, perhaps a raise undead spell that can return dead enemies to life as allied zombies or demons would be cool and compliment the necromancer theme of the religion.

This game is a lot of fun and I'm a fan. However the game has a lot of potential and it needs an update for balance and gameplay. This game is all about building choices and there's really only one good option out of the already limited selection (healers and paladins.) Any other variation is more frustrating than interesting. Castors are so weak they usually just die immediately. There needs to be stronger combinations of heroes to play with. The mission types are basically all the same ...defeat all the baddies. How about some different modes like survival. Would love to see some updates.
replyContent: Brennan, thanks a lot for your feedback. We appreciate your ideas and will keep them in mind. However, as for all mission types being the same, the point of the whole game is to protect your kingdom and to defeat monsters, so it's quite natural that all missions will be about killing all the baddies in different variations :)

The original Majesty was an amazing mobile port that kept the spirit of the original game without adding obnoxious casual internet game (spam your friends, spend real world money on virtual items) features. This add on actually improves on the first game! The graphics and the interface are even better this time around. I really hope HeroCraft comes out with more expansions. All mobile games should aspire to be this good. My sole complaint (more of a suggestion) is that there is too much detail to really play this game on a phone. Everything is much too small. I play it on a 9.7 inch tablet and I find it to be much more manageable.

Two issues (so far):  1) When you click on the sign to take you to this expansion from the original game's map, it expects you to be online to load it.  I know I can load it directly and that this sign is what will give you an option to download or buy the expansion, but once downloaded and/or purchased, the sign should take you to the expansion without requesting to be online or just remove the sign.  2) When looking at one of the buildings options panels, the "X" icon to close the panel blocks the view of how many heroes you have.  This is very important information to have (especially while under attack).  If I'm not aware that I've lost heroes, I will want to hire more immediately before upgrading a building or whatever.  This is not the case in the original game and I'm sure it is an oversight.
